frameDefinitions: An Initial_element is converted into a Final_element via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the Element.  '5.5 percent of nucleii decay from tritium to He3 in a year .'
In this frame a Patient is in a phase brought about after a change of phase.
In this frame a Patient undergoes a change of phase.
In this frame a Patient, which is  an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decaying from an Initial_state to a Result.
A Cause or Agent causes a Patient to undergo a change of phase.
frameExamples: 5.5 percent of nucleii <t>decay</t> from tritium to He3 in a year .
Collect up the  <t>thawed</t> water from the freezer section.
The leaves <t>rotted</t> into a mass of slime.
listRoleDefinitions: A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.
The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location where the nuclear process occurs.
The <fen>Substance</fen> is the entity which has had its phase altered.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the rotting occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the rotting occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to change phase.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change of phase brought about by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the Time at which the change of phase occurs.
This role identifies the place where change of phase occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The leaves</fex> rotted into a mass of slime.
<fex>Before he could get to the specimen</fex> , its entrails had decomposed so badly that they had to be thrown away.
Any traces of uneaten food will decompose <fex>in your tank</fex> and foul the water.
